page.title: 13A Devon Dairy Farm
page.content: The{Dairy Farm}we went to visit is Liverton Farm.It is situated about a kilometre from Exmouth just off the main road to Budleigh Salterton.Mr Ellett is the farmer there and he manages about 1 square kilometer and a half of land.Everyday he has to milk the cows,then an{Express Dairy}milk tanker comes and takes the milk to {Honiton}where it might go on to {Taunton}or stay in Honiton to be made into butter. The products Express Dairies make out of the{Milk}are Butter, Cheese, Yogurts and Cream. Mr Ellett also grows Wheat and Barley and Grass for winter feed.Some of the grass is dried out for hay and some is made into silage. There are many farms to the N and E of Exmouth, but housing estates are gradually taking over farm land.
